channel.title: Brother can't connect to my server
channel.description: I've had this problem in the past while trying to host on another computer, well now i have it again. My brother can't connect to my server, we have tried localhost (127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0), the local IP (IPV4 Address) and my no-ip. Yes i have all my ports forwarded as i am not new to Private servers.

item.title: Brother can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Medi Medi
item.description:
@Medi wrote:

We are living in the same house, People can log in with 2 clients from the same IP, and i know enough about RSPS’s to know the simple ways around this problem such as hamachi. I just don’t want to listen to him complain :L

Read full topic
item.source: Brother can't connect to my server

item.title: Brother can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Exstasy Exstasy
item.description:
@Exstasy wrote:

modzilla:

The server might also be made to only allow one connection per IP? Thats also a possibility

depends if their living in the same house/ using the same internet…
Have u tried having other people connect?

if not go to your config.java -server sided-

Open it and near the top should be something like Ip Allowed;1
Change the 1 to 2 So you and your brother can both play if your on the same internet.

Read full topic
item.source: Brother can't connect to my server

item.title: Brother can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Medi Medi
item.description:
@Medi wrote:

JavaTC:

If you just want you and your brother on you could use Hamachi, it sucks if it’s a public server but if it’s just a small little private one it’s fine.

Yeah i recommended that to him but hes being stubborn about it. Thanks anyways everyone

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @knight60two knight60two
item.description:
@knight60two wrote:

well my bro tried it on a guest acc not fully recommended but i know that it woul;d work on the admin acc in the computer because when i used PI on guest it said error loading plz wait but when i secretly went on my moms acc it worked same with delta

Read full topic
item.source: Brother can't connect to my server

item.title: Brother can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Medi Medi
item.description:
@Medi wrote:

Fridder:

Open cmd.exe and type ipconfig. What does it say under Default Gateway? What’s your IPv4 address? Are you running your server using jdk1.6.0_whatever or jre6? Jre6 could be a problem, so could your jdk version. Install JDK 27 and when it asks about your current location and whatnot, allow it to a new rule on windows firewall or defender or whatever the fuck its called.

I actually have 26 still since so does he, Default Gateway = 192.168.1.117; We’ve tried that though. Default Gateway = 192.168.1.1. Not sure how they are going to help but :P.

Read full topic
item.source: Brother can't connect to my server
